intro: Abutilon umbelliflorum subsp. occidentale, commonly known as the western velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a shrub or small tree with palmate leaves that are often covered in soft, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
